title: What sans serif Fonts does the London A-Z use?
content:
What sans serif Fonts does the London A-Z use?  
 [www.az.co.uk](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701121525/http:/www.az.co.uk/ "www.az.co.uk")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [A-Z.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701121525/http:/typophile.com/files/A-Z.jpg) | 1.28 MB |
author: cool_hand

comments.content: I'm probably wrong but I see various weights and styles of [Univers](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701121525/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/univers) and a bit of [Helvetica Neue](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701121525/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-helvetica) may be...

It looks like Univers family

but Tottenheim is Helvetica condensed maybe
Helvetica is def. there for some of the large bold weights. The condensed and compressed weights look like Univers but in certain instances they have a straight leg on the R?
